name: EFS Knowledge Base
title: EFS Knowledge Base
body:
Original Confluence URL: https://qbdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/1LS/pages/2552758313/EFS+Knowledge+Base - please cross-check the quality of the ZD article with the Confluence counterpart and remove this line before publishing the ZD article

Overview

This article provides a comprehensive guide to various EFS (Enterprise Feedback Suite) features and functionalities, including Diary Surveys, Language Settings, Redirect Links, and more. It serves as a knowledge base for both internal use and customer support.

 

Information

This guide covers multiple topics related to EFS, offering detailed instructions, examples, and documentation for various survey types and functionalities. The information is presented in both German and English, where available.

 

  • Diary Survey
  • Language Settings
  • Redirect Links
  • ATS RTS
  • PDF Receipt
  • Vignettes
  • Discrete Choice Experiment
  • Rename Continue Button
  • Equal Distribution via Quotas

 

Diary Survey

Diary Survey is a project type originally built as customizing for Kantar. It allows for personalized surveys with panelists.

Key Information

  • Example project can be found at: P:\ceur\GTM.CEUR\PS.CEUR\PS.SUPPORT.CEUR\02_Wissensbasis\Wissen-Präsentationen\Diary project
  • Documentation is available in the same location
  • Built for EFS Version 9.0
  • Requires access to a Panel to draw a sample

Additional Resources

  • Concept Diary Project
  • GfK Textile Circle Project Page

 

Language Settings

This section provides a guide on how to use languages in EFS, including adding a language, creating a language selection question, and solving related issues.

Key Features

  • Adding a language
  • Creating a language selection question
  • Adding translations
  • Solving #undefined# problem

A detailed guide for beginners is available in English: How to... language selection pdf

 

Redirect Links

This section explains how to set up redirect links from external panel providers to EFS and back, not limited to Uniparkers.

Available Documentation

  • PDF guide (ready to send to customers)
  • PowerPoint presentation (internal use only)

 

ATS RTS

This section provides instructions on how to calculate residence time retrospectively in the export (Verweildauer nachträglich berechnen im Export).

Detailed instructions with examples and explanations are available in German: How to ... Verweildauer auf Seite nachträglich bestimmen ATS und RTS

 

PDF Receipt

This section provides detailed instructions for the various options of the new PDF receipt feature (available from version 22.1).

Comprehensive guide available in German: How to... PDF-Quittungen

 

Vignettes

This section explains how to set up and create two independent sets of vignettes for external evaluation.

Detailed guide available in English: How to ... Vignettes

 

Discrete Choice Experiment

This section covers how to create and use cards for Discrete Choice Experiments (Conjoint Analysis), where cards come from one list only.

Detailed guide available in English: How to ... Discrete Choice Experiment

 

Rename Continue Button

This section provides solutions for renaming the Continue button for a single page only, without using recoding triggers.

Key Features

  • Solutions for Responsive Layout 3.1
  • Multi-language support
  • Options with and without JavaScript

Document available in German (internal use only): Continue Button change for a single page via templates

 

Equal Distribution via Quotas

This section explains how to achieve the highest possible equal distribution using the quota function.

Detailed guide available in English: How to... Scenarios via quotas

 

FAQ

What is a Diary Survey?

A Diary Survey is a project type in EFS that allows for personalized surveys with panelists. It was originally built as customizing for Kantar but was never fully finished or released.

How can I add multiple languages to my survey?

You can add multiple languages to your survey by using the language settings in EFS. This includes adding a new language, creating a language selection question, and adding translations for your survey content. For detailed instructions, refer to the language settings guide.

How do I set up redirect links with external panel providers?

To set up redirect links with external panel providers, you need to configure the appropriate settings in EFS. This process allows you to redirect participants from external panels to your EFS survey and back. Detailed instructions are available in the redirect links documentation.

What is the PDF receipt feature?

The PDF receipt feature, available from EFS version 22.1, allows you to generate PDF receipts for survey participants. It offers various options for customization. For more information, refer to the PDF receipt guide.

How do I create independent sets of vignettes?

To create independent sets of vignettes, you need to follow specific steps in EFS. This process allows you to set up two independent lists of vignettes for external evaluation. Detailed instructions are provided in the vignettes guide.

 

Tags: EFS, Survey, Diary Survey, Language Settings, Redirect Links, PDF Receipt, Vignettes, Discrete Choice Experiment, Quotas
